content.description: <math alttext="S e solid plus 3 F 2 gas react to produce S e F 6 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Se(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>SeF</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="delta S naught equals negative 337 joules per mole of reaction, kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>337</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>(mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Substance Approximate<math alttext="S naught joules per mole kelvin" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>S</mi> <mi>°</mi> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>(J/</mtext> <mtext>(</mtext> <mtext>mol</mtext> <mo>⋅</mo> <mtext>K</mtext> <mtext>)</mtext> <mtext>)</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> <math alttext="S e solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Se</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 42 <math alttext="F 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ? <math alttext="S e F 6 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SeF</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 314 The chemical equation above represents the formation of <math alttext="S e F 6 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SeF</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> from its elements, and the table provides the approximate values of <math alttext="S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="S e solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Se</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S e F 6 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SeF</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the data, which of the following mathematical expressions can be used to correctly calculate <math alttext="S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="F 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="S naught equals open bracket, negative 337 plus 314, minus 42, close bracket, joules per mole, kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>337</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>314</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>42</mn></mrow><mtext>]</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
